Literature Review: Infrared (IR) spectroscopic imaging has emerged as a powerful tool in digital histopathology, offering a non-destructive method to analyze the chemical composition and heterogeneity of biological tissues. This review aims to summarize the current state of IR imaging technology, data processing methods, and their integration with machine learning, particularly deep learning, to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of histopathological analysis. Additionally, it proposes a standardized framework for the application of IR spectroscopic imaging in pathology.
